#

$G<<You are alive...>>$C##

Whose is that voice?# Your own?# Have you actually heard it?#

You slowly open your eyes, as thoughts resume their flow in your mind, trying to re-establish contact with reality.
#
It takes several seconds to clear up your sight. You feel quite wrecked.
#Just breathing deeply is a pain. You painfully, slowly sit up, and look around.
#
You don't recognise what you see. You try hard to remember, and it finally gets back to you.
How can you still be alive after being hit by...# the lightning?
#By the way,# you are still soaked to the bone.

$c"Maybe I am dead,# afer all."#$C you say aloud, reconsidering the plausibility of that scenario.
#
In the meanwhile, you look at the small reddish vale that lies downhill.
#There is smoke ascending from what it looks like several fires or arsons.
#

#

$CThe first thing you notice is the sky, streaked with a cloud that looks like a jetstream of a plane.
#It has a strange, alien color.
#
The sun is setting, shedding its last light painting with odd glares the celestial vault,
which is already welcoming the faint sparkle of several stars.
#
A little downhill, you then notice an earth road going down towards the vale.
#It points in the direction of the fires.
#Looking more intently, you discern there must be some kind of village there.
#
It looks like there's nowhere else to go, at the moment.

#
Time passes, and night falls. Light recedes and you find yourself relying on the faint light of the stars.

As darkness takes hold, $rominous reddish glares$C paint the corners of the scene.
#You understand it's the light coming from the fires. You are getting closer.
#

many marks on your skin, especially your arms and face.# You don't even realise it at the moment.

You can't explain the reason of it to yourself, but for some reason, you start chuckling.
#Maybe it's the absurdity of the situation, or maybe it's a nervous reaction.
#
Anyway, you keep on laughing, louder and louder, until your voice becomes hysterical,
distorted, overlapped with its own echo.
##
After a while, you fell quite, the sound disperses around, and you feel some kind of sense of awkardness.

Your mind is rushing.
#$c<<What is this place?>>
#<<Am I dead?>>
#<<Am I in some hell?>>
#<<How do I get home?>>
#<<Is there anybody here?>>
#
$CAfter few moments, you burst out crying.# You weren't expecting it, but you can't help it.
#
After few minutes of what you classify as a pathetic scene, you feel better for some reason.

This is clearly impossible.# You must be dreaming.# Or maybe it's just some kind of sick prank.
#
Whatever it is, it's unacceptable. You feel your rage rising, supercharged by your pain and fear.
It soon becomes too much to hold inside, so you let out a mighty shout.
#
You scream at the space around you.
#To whoever might be listening.
#To your own fate.
#
You feel liberated.

You stand on this hill, like the one that is in front of your house.
#But the similarities end there. There are no places like this around your place,
maybe not even in your whole nation.
#
You are still wondering what happened and how did you end up here.
You try to keep calm, thinking about what to do next.

A small town lies in front of you.
#Or, to better say, what is left of it.
#
There is one main earth road that divides two main groups of houses, and little else.
Many buildings are in flames or already burnt to the ground.
Few others are seemingly intact.
#
There are no vehicles.
#No living soul is to be found around.
#

You keep on walking, and after few seconds you spot the first one.
##
$WA man.$C# Lying on his back, eyes wide open, staring into nothingness.
#An arrow stuck deep in his chest.# $WClearly dead.$C# Few flies buzzing around his mouth already.
##
You retch.

$c<<Where the heck am I...?# What is going on?# What am I supposed to do?>>$C you ask yourself when you feel better.
#
You keep on walking and realise the road is scattered with corpses.# Some kind of battle must have taken place...
#
You keep on walking, slowly, appalled.# You lose track of time, while your mind tries to grasp the reality.
#You cannot find an explanation to any of the things you are experiencing.


##After a while, you find yourself leaning on an empty doorframe of a house, which was somehow spared by the fire.
#
You shake up, shuddering. This reminds you that you should find some kind of shelter for the night,
#get dry,# and possibly not burnt.

apparently talking to the shadows.

dialogues.line: I really have to, haven't I?
dialogues.comment: you hear a squeaky little voice, not distant.

dialogues.line: Well, I guess I have to...
dialogues.comment:
He then adds.#

As if by magic, a little man surfaces out of the shadows. He barely reaches Corolla's waist in height.#
He has a shy look in his eyes.

dialogues.precomment: He stretches up his little wrinkly hand to you and says:
dialogues.line: Hello Kriss, I am Smiurl.
dialogues.comment:
you reciprocate, a little unbelieving. He cannot be just a dwarf.#
He has huge ears, pierced with a plethora of earrings, which jingle faintly with each jolt of his head.#
The nose is also quite big, compared to the rest of the face.#
He's wearing a shirt and a pair of short discolored leather trousers.#
His face looks like it's made to constantly display a lost-puppy-like expression...#

dialogues.precomment: Somehow Corolla must know what you are thinking.#
dialogues.line: Don't let him deceive you... Smiurl is a true valiant when you need him.
dialogues.comment:
Hearing that compliment,#
the little guy lits up everywhere.##
$YL$Gi$Wt$Ce$Br$Ma$cl$Yl$Wy.$C## He actually starts emanating a vague, multicoloured luminescence.#

dialogues.line: Whoa!
dialogues.comment: You exclaim, not believing your eyes.

dialogues.line: Easy, he's innocuous!
dialogues.comment: She laughs heartily.# Her laughter rises up, clear and silvery.

dialogues.line: Smiurl is a mutant.
dialogues.comment: She adds right after.

dialogues.line: Incredible...!
dialogues.comment: You observe him, amazed. In the meantime, he has somehow 'turned off'.

dialogues.line: You aren't angry, are you?
dialogues.comment: He asks with trembling voice.

dialogues.line: Angry?! Why would I be angry?
Everybody hates me...# It's because...# I'm different.
dialogues.comment: He complains, looking down.

dialogues.precomment:
You feel compassion for that little man. You can only imagine how miserable his life must be,#
living surrounded by that kind of human filth.# They must make his life a hell every day.#

You say to him warmly:
dialogues.line: I do not hate you! On the contrary: you guys saved my life... and I still haven't thanked you properly!
Our duty.
dialogues.comment:
She smiles openly.# The white of her teeth uncovers under the light of the stars.#

Smiurl starts glowing again, puffing up all happy.

dialogues.precomment:
You keep walking with them for a while.# You start wondering how people like them can mingle with those thugs.#
What are they doing here?#

You reach an area separated from the rest of the encampent by a group of dry trees.#
You see a few tents next to each other.
dialogues.line: There, you can sleep in the tent with Theo.
dialogues.comment: She points at the biggest of the group.

dialogues.line: Who is...
dialogues.comment: You are about to say, but a man is already coming towards you.

dialogues.line:
Precisely. That's him. Theo, let me introduce you to Kriss.#
Would you kindly provide him a bedroll of yours, at least for tonight?
dialogues.comment:
The giant, from the top of his impressive figure, simply answers:#

$B"Of course."##$C and then, to you:# $B"Come."$C#

dialogues.precomment:
You all walk together to his tent.# She keeps it open for you to enter it, Smiurl peeking from behind her legs.#
She looks at you and smiling confidently says:
dialogues.line: Goodnight. With Theo around, no one will dare getting anywhere near here.
Goodnight... And thank you, again!
dialogues.comment: You reply as she disappears into the night, without a sound.

chapters.text:
You stand inside the tent.## Theo,# expressionless,# is looking at you.#
He looks like he's waiting for you to say something.

objects.answer:
The tent is quite big for your standards. But Theo's massive presence makes it look narrow.#
There are few things around. Behind the giant's shoulders you spot a bedroll, a huge backpack, some... weapons?#
But the most striking feature to be observed is Theo himself.

There's some light coming from a lantern on the ground, so you can spend few instants looking at the guy's appearance.#
He's even taller and massive than Jeorghe, and the similarities end there.#
He has ash blonde hair, almost white,# worn in a thick, quite long braid.#
He has a well-kept beard,# not long,# and just a little darker than the rest of his hair,#
which frames his sturdy, squared face.#

His eyes are clear and cold as ice,# still there is something in him softening his gaze...
And his talking,# even if so succint,# wasn't rough, neither veined with hate like those of the other men around there.
The thing Theo just gave you is very simple and basic. You guess it will just have to do.

actions.answer: He keeps on staring at me...

objects.answer: $B"Hello to you."#$C He says.
$B"Hi to you."#$C He says.
You put the bedroll on the ground, in the area Theo indicated. You fall asleep, too tired and shocked to dream.

condition.refusal: I cannot just lay on the ground.

objects.answer: He gives you a bedroll and points you to the freer side of the tent.

chapters.text:
##$G<<Kriss...>>$C##

You open your eyes.# You hear that 'voice' again.# Are you imagining it?# Are you going crazy?# Who knows.##

Somehow you feel rested enough.# The tent is now empty, Theo must have left earlier.#

The sun seeps through: it must be quite high already.#
You hear noises coming from the camp. It feels like it's rustling with activity.#
You lay down a little longer, not sure about how you should feel. All of this is just crazy.#
You acted impulsively last night. What are you supposed to do now?##

Well, at least you met Corolla and Smiurl and... Theo...# They seem good persons.#

$c<<The hot girl, the dwarf and the giant. What kind of joke is this??>>$C##

You just can't wrap yuour mind around all of it.# At least, not yet.

choices.desc: You don't know what to do. You need more time to assimilate the rality. You stay in bed to think it through.
No point in helplessly laying down. Better move on and see what's coming next.

dialogues.precomment:
You get up, stretch your limbs and go outside shielding your eyes from the sun with your hand.#

All around, the camp is abuzz. Looking at it in the broad daylight, it reveals itself to be bigger than you thought.#

The majority of the tents has been already packed.#
It's full of men and horses going in all directions more or less hastily.#

In the middle of it all, there is an open jeep. The Chief is standing on its hood, distributing orders here and there.##
dialogues.line: Watch out!
dialogues.comment:
At that sudden sound,# you wince,# to say the least.#
Smiurl comes out from behind a pile of straw.

dialogues.precomment: Noticing your reaction, he istantly assumes a sorry expression, while he starts explaining:
dialogues.line:
It's dangerous...## Corolla ordered me to stand guard and give alarm in case of danger.#
She thinks someone may want to hurt you...##
And she's right.
dialogues.comment: You turn around hearing that baritone voice behind you.

dialogues.line: You'd better get ready.# We'll leave soon.# Wear these.
dialogues.comment:
Theo hands you some clothes.
#It is clear that what you're wearing is not suitable for the journey that awaits you.

dialogues.line: Above all,# take off those shoes...
dialogues.comment:
He then adds looking at your popular sneakers.#
You have to admit they look alien in that place.## You go back to the tent to get changed.

dialogues.precomment:
You are lost in your thoughts...##
Ruminating on what's happening,#
if this is all inside your head,#
if you are still alive,
#and many other good amenities.##

Then a voice abruptly snatches you off your thinking:
dialogues.line: Good morning!
dialogues.comment:
At that sudden sound,# you wince,# to say the least.#
Smiurl is poking whit his head into the tent.# He looks at you with a mixture of cheerfulness and agitation.

dialogues.precomment: Noticing your reaction, he istantly assumes a sorry expression, while he starts explaining:
dialogues.line:
Corolla ordered me to stand guard and give alarm in case of danger.#
She thinks someone may want to hurt you...
And she's right.
dialogues.comment: Theo opens wide the tent around Smiurl in order to let himself inside.

dialogues.line: You'd better get ready.# We'll leave soon.# Wear these.
dialogues.comment:
Theo hands you some clothes.
#It is clear that what you're wearing is not suitable for the journey that awaits you.

dialogues.line: Above all, take off those shoes...
dialogues.comment:
He then adds looking at your popular sneakers.#
You have to admit they look alien in that place.## They both leave you alone to let you change.

chapters.text:
You inspect the clothes Theo gave you.#
A big, heavy pair of combat/trekking boots.#
Wide hat which will covers a substantial part of your face.#
Leather trousers, shirt and a kind of cape, resembling a poncho.##

But waht surprises you is a very heavy mallet.#

$c<<What am I supposed to do with this?>>##$C

You wear the clothes, then look more closely at the big hammer.# You can hardly handle it with just one hand.#
You don't recognise the metallic material it's made of.#
The wider sides are adorned with golden friezes, the shorter fitted with metal spikes.##

First, you wonder in what kind of situation you may need to use it.#
Then you wonder how you could even wield it.##

After few instants, you shake your head and put the mallet down with the other weapons there.#
That thing is not for you.

dialogues.precomment: You just finished changing and examining the hammer, when Corolla steps inside.
dialogues.line: Hi! I see you are ready: good.# It's time to go.
What is this place we are going to...?
The Chief heard about a trade caravan in transit in the valley west from here.

dialogues.precomment:
You stare at her, not understanding what she means.# Maybe you assume an expression a bit stupid.#

Corolla puts her hands onto your shoulders,# transfixing you with her eyes:
dialogues.line: We are going to $Wattack$R them,# Kriss.

chapters.text:
-------------------------------
|          CHAPTER 4          |
-------------------------------


The horde rides swiftly across the plateau.# In the front, the Chief in his jeep.#
Horses loaded with weapons and men form clouds of dust,# galloping spurred by their riders.##

You are in the rearguard,# sharing a horse with Smiurl.# Corolla and Theo are right ahead.#

You never thought riding could be so frustrating.#
You fear that when you'll get back on the ground# (if you will ever do),#
someone will have to very mercifully put all of your pieces back together.#
You feel every jolt in your bones;# your ears are full of the shouts coming from that bunch of...##
You don't even know $Wwhat$C they are.#

And what about Smiurl's own shouts?# Uncomprehensible noise.##


After what it feels like an eternity to you, that mess starts to wane.#
The horses slow down, ending up scattered along the edge of a canyon.#
It quite suddenly cuts everybody off.# A long wound scarring the wide, rocky, semi-desert, plain.#

You watch from the distance the Chief jumping on the hood of the car.#
You couldn't identify the model so far, it must be custom made or heavily customised.#
He starts talking loudly:#

$M"The $Wprey$M will get here shortly after sunset. We'll attack them as fast as lightining,#
and we'll have them defeated before they can even reach out for a spear!"#$C

A roar rises from the rabble.#

$c<<What am I doing among these thugs?>>#$C You go back asking yourself.#
Are you about to witness another slaughter?##

$M"The vanguard and I will hide in that cove;# the rest of you will be lying in wait here and there, on the other side."$C#
He points to the other side of the chasm.#

$M"When you'll see us attack from the front, you'll rush down at break-neck speed,#
possibly making a heck of a noise, and deprive them of any escape route." $CAnd he laughs hard.##

$M"See ya!" $CHe salutes with an happy gesture, as if all of you are about to go for a merry trip to the lake.#
You watch him rumble down the craggy stone wall rising a big cloud of dust,#
followed by a significant number of the horsemen.

dialogues.precomment: You are still a bit dazed, when Corolla and Theo catch up with you two.
dialogues.line: Did you enjoy the show?
dialogues.comment: She exclaims with sarcasm.

dialogues.line: We need to find shelter.
dialogues.comment: Theo is intently looking around.

dialogues.precomment: You don't understand what's going on.
dialogues.line: What's happening?

It happens that 'a good, healthy battle' is about to start, as the Chief would say.#
But this time, there's something he does not know.#
For too long he had us all dwell in a snake pit...#
And now, he's gonna reap the betrayal he himself sowed.
dialogues.comment: She utters bitterly.

dialogues.precomment:
You still don't understand.#
Somehow your face must make that clear, because Corolla starts again, in a milder tone:
dialogues.line: Many in the horde are tired of his leadership.# Think about Jeorghe: many others here are just like him.
Each of which would gladly take the three... four of us out!
dialogues.comment: Adds Smiurl, who was quiet so far.

dialogues.line:
And not just us; these thugs have an appetite for killing.#
I cannot stand watching any more villages be burnt to the ground.
dialogues.comment:
She clenches her fists and her jaw,#
embers in her eyes.#

dialogues.line:
Now,# there's no time to explain to you how we ended up with these guys.#
We wanted to warn the Chief about the mutiny plans that are being devised,#
but Jeorghe and his friends prevented us...# Then you arrived out of nowhere...#
Long story short:# all we can do now is hide and hope they won't trouble themselves too much looking for us.

chapters.text:
You are still taking in what Corolla explained to you,# when you reach a cave on the side of the ravine.#
Its access isn't directly visible from where the others are waiting to ambush.#

You prepare to wait.

actions.answer:
The sun is sinking down,# slowly and relentlessly,# anxious and tremulous,#
ready to be swallowed up into night's unfathomed lair,#
giving way to her uncountable shiny emissaries.##

Alien gleams dance on the horizon,# as the strongest rays run the last race,#
darkening on the way and turning the reddish wasteland in a huge tapestry,#
where the armed men are nothing more than maybe-dreamed shapes.

Not the slightest sound disturbs the absolute calm and silence now reigning in the canyon.#
All you can hear is your own blood flowing inside of your ears,#
as well as your heartbeat.#

For all you know,# Theo, Corolla and Smiurl could even have stopped breathing.

The twilight gleam fades away.# Darkness grows thicker.#

At once,# a distant sound.# It must be the caravan you are waiting for.##

Time seems to further slow down its pace.# You can feel the seconds trickle through your fingers as mercury,# liquid,#
painstakingly seeping through and then falling down,# with unbearable slowness,#
almost hesitating,# and,# in the end,# dying on the ground with a thud.

chapters.text:
You start hearing a distant noise.# It must be the convoy.##

After few more endless minutes spent listening to that noise increase,#
you and the others peek outside.#
Down there are a dozen of big slow transports.# Some of them are pulled by horses, others by motor vehicles.#
They are escorted by many horsemen.##

Without delay, the attack begins.#
Shouts arise in the canyon, echoing countless times on the stone walls, confounding the enemy.#
Then the Chief's roaring jeep charges, suddenly appearing out of its hiding place.#
The entire convoy halts suddenly, and the defensors spread aroud the first chariots.#

The stranglehold works, as the rest of the horde attacks them from their back.#
The noise now saturates the canyon like water in a bottle.#

It's all over very soon.# The attackers are taking out the very last men,# when Corolla says alarmed:#

$R"Wait a second!# What is this noise...??"##

A gloomy vibration is quickly increasing, propagating through the canyon, echoing between the rocks.##

Suddenly,# a high sound blares all around;# all the fighters stop, looking around puzzled.#

Abruptly,# the ringing,# deafening horn-like sound stops,# giving way to silence once more.##

And,# quietly,# silently,# the edges of the canyon start getting filled with lights.#
They appear gradually, randomly,# in different sizes and colours.#
They look like $Ywisps,# $Rignis $Bfatuuses,# $Gslowly $Mwiggling $caround.##


$CYou shudder.

$S$KThe darkness gets bluntly ripped apart by a shaft of light,#
pure white refracting in the whole color spectrum,#
blinding you completely.#

There is no use in shutting your eyes,# as the light seems to directly reach into your mind.#

A lot of commotion follows.# When your eyes start to work again you assist to the slaughtering.#
The lights attack somehow everybody in the canyon,# the horde as well as the men of the convoy.#

$s$CIt's all very quick.#
Blinded and panicking, nodoby seems to escape.# After few minutes, it's all over.#

The lights are rushing and fading away in the distance already, leaving only a dead silence behind...

You all stay hidden for a while.# When you are sure it's 'safe',# you cautiously go outside.#

The chariots lie abandoned, their torches still lit. Their scattered faint light reveals aspects of the scene.#

It seems there's no survivor;# from this distance it's hard to say.#

$B"Let's look for survivors."#$C Theo says, unsurprisingly.# His voice sounds like he does not believe he'll find any.##

You follow them, not knowing what to think,# once again.#

As you descend, you encounter an increasing number of bodies.# You are just thankful it's dark:#
you won't have their terrified expressions imprinted in your memory forever.##

You all go towards a plume of smoke rising from behind a big boulder.#
Behind there is the Chief's jeep, which upholstery is feeding the flames you saw.#

$Y"The Chief!"$C Smiurl shouts out.#

Then you see him.# Sitting on the ground, his back against the front fender.#
He must be dying;# he's losing a lot of blood from a conspicuous wound in his chest.#
Not just you, also Corolla, Theo and Smiurl freeze looking at him, not knowing what to say.#
Thus it surprises you, the fact that after few instants you step forward.#

The Chief slowly lift his chin looking at you, and,# despite everything,# he manages to grin.

$M"Were you a spy after all...?" $CHe coughs, blood leaking from the corner of his mouth.#
Then he seems to notice the others:#

$M"I should have expected this..."$C He looks back at you, and after taking one painful breath,#
he smirks one more time, then adds:#

$M"Young man,# what about...# avenging me..."$C# But his last words die this way along with his last breath.##

You all stand there still, unable to do anything.#
After all you witnessed since you arrived in this place, you feel like you have just reached the point of no return.#
You feel like something in you mind just cracked.# Like you're losing touch with reality.##

Then,# it happens.##

$cYou find yourself walking towards him.# You feel like you're projected outside of your own body,#
as if $Gsomeone else$c is moving your muscles.#
You lean on him and absent-mindedly observe your own hands untying his sword from his side.
#Next thing you notice,# you are wielding it,# pointed to the sky,# staring at the blade glinting with ominous glares.##


$CIn the meantime, Smiurl has retracted in himself, gaining a brownish hue.#
Theo is back to being impassible as usal.#
For some reason,# Corolla seems to approve your actions and retrieves the Chief's chain.

You suddenly come back to your senses.# You return to feel the ground beneath your feet,#
the air of the night against your skin,# the glances of the other three,#
the mighty weight of the sword,# too long and heavy to be wielded with one hand only.#

You immediately put it down with the tip in the ground,# then you lean with your own weight on it.

$R"Are you ok...?"#$C Asks you Corolla, putting a hand on your shoulder.#

$c"Huh? I think...# I think I am..."#$C You answer.# But you have no idea what just happened.##

$B"We camp here, until daybreak."#$C Theo deliberates, walking back to the cave.

-------------------------------
|          CHAPTER 5          |
-------------------------------


$cAll around you is thick darkness.#
You have no body,# no eyes.#
Just an adimensional point,# in the void.#
You 'hear' hollow sounds around,# like thunders.##

Then, you think you can see sinisters glares.#
The Chief's sword gets closer and closer,# its tip menacingly pointed at your eyes.#
The shiny edge is ever closer,# closer...##

You shout.# The darkness reacts,# vibrating in response to such a huge amount of anger and pain.#
Then,# suddenly,# as answering to the farthest echoes of your unaware call,# light comes to you.#
A blinding flash hits you,# piercing through every particle in your body.##

You are one with the light now.#
You hear a warm voice whispering,# or maybe thinking of whispering:##

$G<<Have courage!>>##

$c...# Are you not alone?

The light keeps on tormenting you.# You open your eyes, and realise the sun is lighting your face.#
Was it just a dream?##

You rub your eyes, stand up and exit the cave.#
As you stretch your body,# you look around.# Someone has lit a fire.#
You appreciate its warmth,# as you feel the chill early morning air on your skin.##

The absurdity of what you're experiencing comes back haunting you.##
What is this place?# Who are these people?# Where is home?##

Everything is too surreal to be true.# The Horde...# And what about them three?#
The girl has something peculiar, something that makes her different from the others around.#
There is a special light in her eyes,# and her poise is always elegant,# self-confident# and seductive.#
In her gaze there's something noble, something you sense clearly in the giant as well.#
Only the dwarf seems to be completely unrelated to everything and everyone else you've seen so far...#

But,# somehow,# you don't know why but you feel you can trust them.#
Maybe they are savages,# but not $Wanimals$C.##


Interrupting your thoughts,# Smiurl appears from behind a boulder,# carrying some bundle in his arms.
Standing close to the fire, you think about what to do next.

choices.desc: You are starving. Ask Smiurl about breakfast.
You need to know what's going on... Before something else happens.
Better look around the caravan spoils for something useful.
You are done here. Better get moving now.

dialogues.line: Oh! Goodmorning Kriss! Slept well? Are you hungry?
dialogues.comment: He anticipates you, thoughtfully.

dialogues.line: Hi Smiurl. I am not entirely certain, but I'm hungry for sure!

dialogues.precomment: He goes next to the fire and starts handling and unpacking the stuff he has carried.
dialogues.line:
The chariots have been raided... But I managed to find some food.#
Here it is: a jar of water,# some brandy,# dried meat, some sand-fruit and pears...
Sand-what?

Sand-fruit!# Don't tell me you don't know what they are!# It's a delicacy.#
They should be prepared with Pinzerro sap, shouldn't they?#
I guess I'll have to work it out with what I have here...

dialogues.precomment:
You still have no idea what he's talking about.# He hands you one of them to let you see.#
It looks a bit like a seashell, as big as a walnut.
dialogues.line: What kind of stuff is this?
I can't believe you're asking it! These are Croeggs larvae.
Larvae?...# You mean...# insects??
dialogues.comment: You give him back his 'sand-fruit'.

dialogues.line: Insects, of course! But not just any insect.# An elder Croegg can weigh as much as you.# I caught one this big once...
dialogues.comment: And he measures the air indicating something over one meter long.

dialogues.precomment: You must have made a disgusted expression, as he adds, after looking suprised seeing your face:
dialogues.line: Well, I'll have to eat your serving too!
dialogues.comment: And he merrily takes the sand-fruit back.

dialogues.line: Listen, Smiurl...
dialogues.comment: You start, looking at him seriously.

dialogues.line: Could you tell me something...?# I mean...## Where are we exactly?

dialogues.precomment: #He looks at you, puzzled.
dialogues.line: Uh? We're still in the canyon, aren't we? What do you mean...
I don't think that's what he's asking.
dialogues.comment: You hear Theo and Corolla approaching from behind your back.

dialogues.line: Yep.
dialogues.comment:
#

You turn around. They stop and stand there staring at you.#
They seem to expect from you to say something next.

dialogues.precomment:
$c<<That's it>># $CYou think. #$c<<The 'moment of truth'>>$C Where to start?#
You start with the very basics.# You smile nervously, and say in a quiet voice:
dialogues.line: First of all,# we are still on Earth,# right?

dialogues.precomment: Corolla startles. Even Theo's face darkens,# in spite of his usual imperturbability.
dialogues.line: No.
dialogues.comment: The little guy answers simply,# as it was a normal thing for you to say.

dialogues.line: This is $WNoi-Hert$Y.
dialogues.comment: He looks at you calmly, as he continues preparing breakfast.

dialogues.line: Huh??# No-what??
dialogues.comment: As your disbelief increases.

dialogues.line: Wait a minute...# Kriss,# could you tell us in which time are we?

dialogues.precomment: Afraid of answering at this point, you almost beg:
dialogues.line: Please,# tell me this is the 21st century!

dialogues.precomment: Corolla bows her head, looking away.# Theo shakes his.
dialogues.line: You'd better sit down,# young man.
dialogues.comment:
#

Then,# he starts talking again.

chapters.text:
$BNoi-Hert was discovered five centuries after the Great Religion War,#
few decades after interstellar travel was made possible.#

It was the first inhabitable planet discovered by the Earthers ships.#
It is a little smaller than the Earth, about two-thirds of its volume,#
but it has a greater nucleus density, so the gravity is about the same.#

With just a little moon, it orbits lonely around a G-type star
that everybody called sun but had no real name.#

Over time, the Earthers established many colonies on the surface,#
for commercial, reasearch and overpopulation reasons.#

The best and the worst of the Earth arrived here.#
A lot of brilliant minds, scientists, artists, pursuing new discoveries
and exploring new horizons, with a whole planet at their disposal.#
But, also, a lot of low-lives, jailbirds, the most despicable
from every kind of culture and environment, fleeing from the world
that rejected, hunted them down relentlessly.#

A huge penitentiary complex was also built on the other side of this planet,#
as this side flourished giving way to new, unmatched scientific progress.#
There was space for everybody, and every commodity and resource#
was shipped by the Earth on its $WTitans$B, the huge orbital ships.#

But this was one of the reasons of the collapse, too.

$BOne day, without notice, after some twenty years of frantic development,#
the Earthers abandoned the colonies to themselves.##

In time, legends started spreading.#
Funny stories about spirits of this planet emerging from the sea and the land to drive out the human invaders,#
only sparing those who were born here.# At first, very few believed such myths.#
The wisest ones were convinced there had to be a way more concrete explanation behind all of it.#
A war,# maybe some cataclysm,# on the Earth...##

Regardless of the actual reason, the colonists soon realised there was little they could do,#
in order to limit the damage deriving from the exile imposed on them.#
Without the Titans, global communications broke down, as well the great commercial routes.#
Machines and Earth technology started to fade as there was no proper supply chain
to refurbish and repair and improve the existent.#
Without access to Earth's knowledge, scientists and researchers had to start over, takin a massive leap backwards.##

Then,# with decades, centuries,# the old generations were replaced,#
giving way to a fragmenting society led by the strongest, most violent elements.#

Hordes started forming and everything descended more and more into anarchy.

dialogues.precomment:
You sit down on the ground taking in what Theo just told you.# $c<<He never talks, but when he does...!>>$C##

You try to make some sense of his story,# and after few minutes of silent meditating, you resolutely say:
dialogues.line: I can't believe it.## It would mean I traveled through time!# It's clearly impossible!
We're having an hard time believing you too, so we are kinda even...
dialogues.comment: Corolla smiles shrugging her shoulders.

dialogues.precomment:
You still can't wrap your mind around it.##
What are you doing there?# Where will you go?# What will be of you?#
You think about all the people you left home, they must be so worried...#
$c<<You are a missing person>># $CYou say to yourself.##

Corolla sees your distress,# kneels next to you and says, hand on your shoulder:#
dialogues.line: Do not worry too much now.# We'll find an answer somehow.

dialogues.precomment:
You look at her, still depressed.# Why do she and the others seem to care about you?#
Looking at her expression, you manage to produce half a smile and say, actually feeling it:
dialogues.line: Thanks...

dialogues.precomment:
You slowly walk towards what's left of the convoy.# You are already having second thoughts,#
since you have to traverse that field of death alone now.#

Luckily, you spot Theo far ahead and Corolla too,# among the wreckage.# They must have thought the same thing.##

In the daylight, the view is miserable.#
Bodies,# burnt chariots,# debris...##
You start thinking about the eventuality of searching the bodies...##

$Y"Hey look what I found!"$C Smiurl calls from behind.#

You and the others walk to him to see.#

He's leaning over a body, close to his dead horse.# You don't recognise him.# Was he one of the defensors?
dialogues.line: What's this stuff?
dialogues.comment: Corolla points at some kind of armor the guy wears.# Wore.# You got it.

replies.line: You think it's time to man up. Show her... them... you are not a crybaby.
Getting even closer? Touching the dead body? no way!

dialogues.precomment:
You kneel down.# You try not to look the dead man in his glassy eyes.# You focus on the plates on his chest.##
You touch slighlty the surface of the armor, and suddenly it lights up!#
You abruptly withdraw your hand, and the armor fades off again, slowly.#
Before shutting off completely, it lights up with glares like little electrical storms, looking like...# holograms?
dialogues.line: What the...!

dialogues.precomment:
Theo senses your hesitation, and quickly kneels down.#
He touches slighlty the surface of the armor, and suddenly it lights up!#
He abruptly withdraws his hand, and the armor fades off again, slowly.#
Before shutting off completely, it lights up with glares like little electrical storms, looking like...# holograms?
dialogues.line: What the...!

dialogues.precomment:
Theo grabs several plates, pulling them and detaching them from the rest of the armor.#
You all go in a well lit place, and away from the body, to better look at that piece of technology.#

You watch as Theo handles the plates, studying them from every angle.#
After a short while he points at some kind of bulge with two indicator lights.
dialogues.line: This is the energy supply...

dialogues.precomment: Then, pointing at the whole thing:
dialogues.line: This can only be a product of Ayonn.

dialogues.precomment: Smiurl shrieks in fear.
dialogues.line: Are you sure of it?
dialogues.comment: She asks, suddenly serious.

dialogues.line: Absolutely. No one else has tech like this anymore.

dialogues.precomment: After a while, you break the silence:
dialogues.line: What this Ayonn would be?
The legendary city of Ayonn, the impenetrable!
dialogues.comment: He declaims, with a fearful voice.

dialogues.line: Impenetrable?
Yes! Ayonn, the city of light, protected by its everlasting magic shield!
dialogues.comment: He breathes in sharply, then continues:

dialogues.line:
You see, Ayonn is the magical city which resist, eternal, since the times of the abandon!#
Nobody can get in, not even get close to it.#
Its magic shield is an invincible defense, even from just the $Wthought$Y of attacking it!#

Inside the city are untold riches and luxuries...#
And they say the few dwellers of the city that have ever been seen,# they shine their own light!
dialogues.comment:
He explains in an excited crescendo.#
Then he falls silent at once, as if he fears his own words.

dialogues.line: Interesting.# At least this could explain what we saw last night...
dialogues.comment: You say unimpressed.

dialogues.line: And this armor as well
dialogues.comment: Theo concludes.

chapters.recap: is this my party - towards Ayonn
chapters.text:
You walk away from the fire and the others.#
You start to have a weird feeling.#

You can't be here just randomly.# There must be some reason.#

And if there is a thing you know now,# it's you won't have peace until you'll find it.##

$c<<And these guys here they seem to believe in me.# Like they were...# waiting for someone like me?>>#

<<What am I thinking!# What should I expect from myself now,# to become their leader?>>$C#

You are lost in your thoughts, looking at the horizon.#
You barely notice the others getting close to behind you.#
You barely notice your own hand moving,# as it has its own will,# reaching for the sword.##

You don't know what you feel more,# if surprised,# or determined,# when you find yourself exclaiming,#
while you theatrically draw your sword,# pointing it to the west:##

$c"To Ayonn!"

dialogues.line: Hey Kriss...# tell me...# how did you know this was the direction to take?
dialogues.comment:
Smiurl asks you,#
while he fights with the straps of his backpack, almost double in size compared to him.

dialogues.line: Huh...?# I don't know...## Instinct?
dialogues.comment: You shrug your shoulders, smiling at the little guy.

dialogues.precomment: Corolla is silently looking sideways at you.# Theo notices it,# then says:
dialogues.line: You got guts, kid,# that's for sure...

Why would I?# It can't be so terrible...# I mean,# It's just a city.#
Besides,# we go in peace.# I don't see why...
dialogues.comment:
You stop talking,# seeing how Theo looks away and sighs,#
silently staring at the ground in front of his feet.##

You all fall silent for the rest of the morning.#

You wonder if everyone is busy thinking about what's going on,# if they should stop indulging you.#
You still don't understand why they're sticking to you.#

It is with relief, after few hours,#
that you stop and sit down against a rock,# when Theo signals to rest and eat something.

chapters.text:
The weight of the sword tied on your backpack had started taking its toll.#
You insisted in wanting to carry it yourself.# You wonder if it actually makes sense,#
but something prevents you from parting with it.#
You feel like it's $cyour sword$C.##

The fact that you just took it from the Chief means nothing to you.#
Even if it did not belong to you until today,#
even if you have never seen any sword up close in the first place.

actions.answer:
The reddish landscape stretches wide all around you.# You think it looks like Arizona, or Nevada, back on earth.#

Back on earth.## Ridiculous.##

The sun hits hard on you;# now you thankfully understand why the hat.

How exactly far this Ayonn city is?# How long will it take to get there?#
You start to worry:# you have only a limited supply of food with you.#
How will you survive the desert?

objects.answer:
$B"We have enough for 3 days. Then, we will hunt."#$y So naturally.

#You wonder what kind of prey he has in mind.# All you saw so far were just few lizards.#

Well,# you already decided you will need to trust these guys,# so no use in worrying at this point.

$Y"We have two days worth of water. We need to find some more along the way."#

$yYou try not to look worried.#

$Y"Don't you worry about that.# It's not our first time in the desert!"#$y He smiles at you reassuringly.

$R"The location of the city of Ayonn is not a mistery.#
At least, the approximate location, since it's a legendary place we're talking about"$y# she smirks.#

$R"So...# the so-called plain of Ayonn it's ten days of walking west from here.#
At the end of this desert, we'll have to cross the Mazerock.# Then...# We'll see."#

$ySmiurl squeals.

$Y"Just another example of Ayonn's defenses!# A tricky place from which no one has ever returned!#
If the place itself doesn't kill you,# an Oxengutter or some other fiend will surely fix it!"#$y You gulp.#

$R"Stop it Smiurl... we can deal with any kind of natural maze,#
and surely we can deal with some Oxengutter of any sort."#$y You marvel at her confidence.#

Theo, as per usual, doesn't even seem interested in what they're saying.

$B"Don't pay attention to everything Smiurl says...# And trust me,# you don't even want to know that."#
$yHis words do not reassure you,# that's for sure.

actions.answer:
You all sit with your shoulder against a boulder, sheltered from the high sun.#
You eat some of the food prepared before by Smiurl, and drink some of the water.#

You really needed this.# The others do not look tired at all,# compared to you.
$R"Better keep going.# It's still a long way."$y

condition.refusal: You need to rest for a while.

chapters.text:
The sword is very long and heavy.# It is perfectly balanced.#
The long grip seems made of some metal, darkened through time.# But it's surprising, to the touch.#
It feels like it adapts perfectly to your hands,# as if it is...# alive.# It is not cold nor rigid.#
It is extremely hard though, and it resists all of your attempts at sctratching it.#

You shrug your shoulders,# and you move on to inspect the blade.#

The blade is double-edged,# and this looks weird to you because it is also slightly curved.#
It's four fingers wide at the intersection with the guard,#
then it spreads outward with an arc on each side reaching about a handbreadth.#
The width decreases towards the point.# And the point looks strange: it is oddly asymmetrical,#
as if the blacksmith wanted to make it look as a broken, splintered blade,# that was later resharped as a razor.#

You think it's impossible to fight with a weapon like that.#
Nonetheless, when you wield it you feel as your arm is one thing with the sword,#
and it does not looks like you and the sword move in a clumsy or unbalanced way at all.##

The metal of the blade itself looks strange.# It reflects the light unevenly,#
and you don't know why but you think it's like its molecular structure is constantly shifting.#
Sometimes you can see your own image reflected on the blade as a mirror;#
yet a second after the reflection seems to swim or evaporate in different directions,#
as if it is subject to a sudden and impossible turbulence.#
If you keep on staring at it, the blade looks like it's subtly moving back and forth,#
like a living thing,# even if it's cold and solid to the touch.#

As if all of that isn't enough,# you also feel like you can glimpse an inscription flowing along its entire lenght.#
But it's more a feeling than an actual visual input.# You can't explain it to yourself.

dialogues.precomment:
You sigh,# ceasing your examination.# It doesn't seem there is much else you can discover now.#
You look up,# and see your friends staring at you.# You did not notice they fell silent earlier.
dialogues.line: What is it?
You spent a lot of time lost in contemplation...
You looked like you were in a trance.
dialogues.comment: Smiurl intervenes.

dialogues.line:
...you actually looked like you were somewhere else, totally alienated.#
Are you sure you are well?
dialogues.comment: She continues.

dialogues.line: Sure, never been better...
dialogues.comment: You are not entirely sure about that,# still,# you don't feel unwell either.

dialogues.line: Good thing...
dialogues.comment: She sighs.

chapters.text:
After another couple of hours spent walking,# the flat scene in front of you shows the first change.#
A kind of spire of rock,# solitary,# direction south-west.#
It appears fading in:# you now become aware of the atmoshperic haze that limits visibility to maybe 20 kilometers.#

dialogues.line: What is that?
dialogues.comment: You ask.

dialogues.line: A rock like many others.# There's nothing else in this desert but sun and rocks.
dialogues.comment: Smiurl shrugs.

dialogues.precomment:
You go back peering at the distant shape.# You can't stop staring at it.#
Once again,# you perceive something weird, something you can't explain.#

You keep on walking, eyes on the top of the pinnacle.#
It's a vague feeling,# you wonder if it isn't just your sight deceiving you:#
the rock looks like it's moving, or like it's glowing slightly.#
You hear or think to hear faint sounds, like many barely perceptible whispers.##
dialogues.line: Hey!
dialogues.comment: He suddenly exclaims, breaking that 'spell'.

dialogues.line: Huh...? What?
dialogues.comment: You snap out of your mind focus.

dialogues.line: It's like ten minutes now, you've been walking like a ghost, staring into nothing...
Ten minutes...?
dialogues.comment: They felt like few seconds to you.

dialogues.line: Is something wrong?
dialogues.comment: Corolla asks you.

dialogues.line: Erm...# No...# I mean, maybe...# I can't explain it.# I don't even know if it's not just my imagination.

dialogues.precomment:
Everybody falls silent for a while.# You keep on watching each other,# in turns.#
After a while,# you feel that kind of impulse,# and say abruptly and resolutely:
dialogues.line: I want to see this through.# Let's go to the spire!

dialogues.precomment: Corolla questions Theo with her eyes.# He says:
dialogues.line:
Are you sure of this?# We don't have much food and water.# A detour like this could cost us a lot.#
Is it really necessary?

dialogues.precomment: You stare into those imperturbable sky blue eyes.
dialogues.line: I believe it is.# But,# you don't have to come with me...
dialogues.comment:
You start saying,#
still feeling there's no reason why they should baby-sit you.

dialogues.line: Nonsense!# We won't leave you alone...
Then it's settled.

chapters.text:
You reach the rock wall at sunset.# The feeling hasn't left you.# On the contrary, it intensified.#

The spire has revealed itself to be bigger than you expected.# It's more like a peak,# a small, sharp mountain.#
It also looks higher, now that you are standing at its foot.##

A natural tower in the middle of the desert.##

$R"Don't you think we'd better camp here for tonight?"$C Corolla asks,#
seeing how yearningly you're looking at the vertical rock wall.#

$Y"I'm tired... we walked all day."$C Smiurl adds, complaining.#

You are not sure about what to do.# Your sensation it's so strong now, you can't think of anything else.

choices.desc: You don't know why or how, you just know you have to climb that mountain right now.
Corolla is right. Night is about to fall, and you are all tired.

chapters.text:
You agree with Corolla, slowly turning away from the wall in front of you.#
Smiurl starts to unpack in order to light a fire and eat.#

$B"We'll take turns guarding tonight."$C Theo states.##

You eat sitting around the fire.#
Nobody talks much,# and soon comes the time to sleep.#

You fight to ignore the whispers you are still convinced to be hearing,#
and finally fall in a restless sleep.

A $Wshout$C awakes you abruptly.##
You sit up, trying to understand what's happening.# Under the starlight, you can only partially guess.#
What shocks you is the noise.##

A... Growl?# Howl?# Snarl?##

It's interrupted only by loud thuds followed by Theo's grunts.#

You hear Corolla and Smiurl shouting at each other and at you.#

Adrenaline rushes through you;# you frantically shoot out of your bedroll trying to reach your sword.##

Something hits you,# you're on the ground now, on your back.##
Something is keeping you pinned.#
The only thing you can see are two malevolent eyes,# glinting menacingly in the darkness.#

The last thing you see,## the fangs of the beast upon you,# shining under the faint light of the night.$d###


-- GAME OVER --##


$DYou just died. You will start again from the last checkpoint. Make wiser choices, traveler.

$c"I can't wait the whole night under here...# I couldn't sleep anyway.#
My...# 'sensation' now is so strong, it wouldn't let me rest.# I have to go,# now.#
You can wait for me here..."$C#
You don't even wait for their answer: you turn your back and start walking towards the crag.#

You don't understand what compels you like that, you just know you can't help it now.#

$R"Hey!# What are you thinking?"$C Corolla shouts from behind after a while.#
You see you upset her.# You feel guilty,# but comforted too seeing that the three of them are still following you.#
Her, in the front.# Smiurl, obediently following her.# Theo, impassible, on the rear.#

They reach you.# Her look is hard, as she stares you in the eyes.# But soon she softens.#
She rolls her eyes and snorts: $R"Oh, don't ask me why, I can't be mad at you.# Let's climb this thing."#

$CYou can't help feeling relieved.

Your hand slips, losing grip.##
The stone under your foot crumbles.#

You hear Corolla screaming as you fall off the precipice.$d###

The stone under your foot crumbles.#

You hear Corolla screaming as you fall off the precipice.$d###
